GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
ACT
No. 33 of 2016
Date of Assent: 6th June, 2016
An Act to provide for the composition, functions, tenure and
procedures of the Citizenship Board of Zambia; make
procedural provisions for the acquisition, deprivation and
renunciation of citizenship of Zambia; repeal and replace
the Citizenship of Zambia Act, 1975; and provide for
matters connected with, or incidental to, the foregoing.
[7th June, 2016
ENACTED by the Parliament of Zambia. Enactment

Tenure of 5. (1) A member of the Board shall hold office for a term of

(2) The office of a member becomes vacant if the member—

written law and sentenced to imprisonment for a period
exceeding six months without the option of a fine;
(f) is removed by the President; or
(g) has a mental or physical disability that makes the member
incapable of performing the duties of a member.
(3) A member may resign by giving one month’s notice, in

(4) A member shall, on the expiration of the period for which
the member is appointed, continue to hold office until a successor
is appointed, but in no case shall the further period exceed four
months.
(5) Whenever the office of a member becomes vacant before
the expiry of the term of office, the President may appoint another
person to be a member in place of the member who vacates the
office for the unexpired term of that office.
Proceedings 6. (1) Subject to the other provisions of this Act, the Board

(2) The Board shall meet for the transaction of its business at

(3) Three members shall form a quorum at a meeting of the
Board, one member of which shall be the Chairperson.

imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, or to both.
